message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of testing whether an unknown distribution belongs to a specified family of distributions, which is a fundamental problem in statistics and theoretical computer science. The paper proposes a general testing technique based on the Fourier transform, which is applicable to all distribution families whose Fourier spectrum satisfies a certain approximate sparsity property. The paper then applies this technique to obtain near sample-optimal and computationally efficient testers for several fundamental distribution families, including Sums of Independent Integer Random Variables, Poisson Multinomial Distributions, and Discrete Log-Concave Distributions. Based on this, the most likely sub-categories are cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
